metadata.title: CVE-2019-15118 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
check_input_term in sound/usb/mixer.c in the Linux kernel through 5.2.9mishandles recursion, leading to kernel stack exhaustion.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15118` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-166-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-generic - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-166-lowlatency - 4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needs-triage ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-166.195~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1056.60').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1061.66~14.04.1').
